segments.text: I can’t believe how careless the woman is, letting the sink overflow like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying a plate, while water ruins her kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so naughty, taking cookies without asking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall any second now, and she won’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, like it’s completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m shocked the woman hasn’t turned around yet to see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is so unstable, and the boy is reaching so far—it’s a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman wakes up and turns off the water before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
